resources.string: <-Swipe left and right to change floor ->

" Date: 1600s
" "Location: North Devon

""North Devon in south-west England was renowned as a centre for pottery" " production and fragments are often found in excavations in throughout Ireland. Imports from" "the American colonies were roued through English pors, before being sent to Ireland, giving" "merchants in the north Devon ports the opportunity to add their pottery onto the ships" "bound for Galway.

""Separate cargoes of just pottery were also sent to Galway, John Davie, a merchant from" "Bideford in North Devon, for example, shipped ‘one hundred dozen of earthenware’ in 1672." "The importation of pottery from North Devon to Ireland seems to have peaked at the end of" "the 17th century and dwindled during the following century.

"
"Loan from National Museum of Ireland
"
